We sent her to boarding school with inheritance from Tom's uncle. But Mary missed us, and one night she ran back to us from Maidstone. We hugged her and decided she wouldn't go back. When she was older, she fell in love with Bill Jarvis, a blacksmith's son. They were to marry, and I felt a tug at my heart, knowing I'd lose my dear Mary. On the night before the wedding, Tom returned home looking pale and sober.
